result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald J Gammon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).
  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).
  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).
  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).
  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).
  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other sentence, with credit for 1 day (6-03-2015) time served.
**Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered uncharged conduct (5/12/09 - 6/1/10) dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.**

miscConds.notes:
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Restitution is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge (only as to Count 1), DNA surcharge as to Count 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 and 7 is not imposed. To be paid during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Defendant may not work in any position that requires him to handle controlled substance or give him access to a controlled substance.
Drivers license suspension is not imposed.

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days/ 72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ronald J Gammon in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 1 day (6-03-2015) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 2-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 1 day (6-03-2015) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 3-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 1 day (6-03-2015) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 4-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 1 day (6-03-2015) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 5-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 1 day (6-03-2015) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 6-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 1 day (6-03-2015) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 7-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 1 day (6-03-2015) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNTS 1 throught 7:
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days/ 72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
- Maintain fulltime employment.
- Defendant may not work in any position that requires him to handle controlled substance or give him access to a controlled substance. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Restitution is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge (only as to Count 1), DNA surcharge as to Count 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 and 7 is not imposed. To be paid during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Sentencing documents with attached cover letter from Attorney Johnson, received and filed.

Defendant Ronald J Gammon in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.

AS TO COUNTS 1 THRU 7:

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered uncharged conduct (5/12/09 - 6/1/10) dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims, and the defendant. Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing and restitution in Branch 17.

Defendant Ronald J Gammon in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Court in trial on another matter, case adjourned for plea and sentencing hearing on 10-15-15 at 8:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ronald J Gammon in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Parties requesting additional time as negotiations continue. Case adjourned for projected plea hearing on 09-15-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.    Parties notified that effective August 1, 2015, Branch 17 will be located in the Safety Building, room 310. Plea hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ronald J Gammon in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Danielle Chojnacki for Patricia Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Scheduling conference held. A projected guilty plea date was selected. Court informed the parties that any motions should be filed by the next court date. Court ordered that the State is to share all discovery with the defense by 07/02/2015. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED IN THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT WITHIN 24 HOURS. FAILURE TO DO SO WILL RESULT IN A WARRANT TO ISSUE.

Defendant Ronald J Gammon in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Ronald Dague for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of any controlled substances or drug paraphenilia without a valid prescription.
Defendant may need to be booked by the Milwaukee County Sheriff's department. Defendant may have been booked and must verify by the next court date  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 06-03-2015 at 08:30 am.
